thread.title: Can Another Michael Vick Comeback Save the Steelers’ Season?
thread.title_full: Can Another Michael Vick Comeback Save the Steelers’ Season? - The New York Times

author: William C. Rhoden
title: Can Another Michael Vick Comeback Save the Steelers’ Season?
text:
PITTSBURGH — In May, the ever-confident Michael Vick wondered whether he finally had come to the end of the road. Vick had parted ways with the Jets after a dismal season and was left to wonder if any team would take a chance on an aging quarterback who, once upon a time, had been the most electrifying player in the N.F.L.
So Vick waited, maintaining a rigorous workout regimen and telling a reporter , “I just want to stay ready and confident when opportunity knocks.”
Opportunity tapped at his door in August and Vick was signed by the Pittsburgh Steelers after their backup quarterback, Bruce Gradkowski, was lost for the season. Then on Sunday, opportunity knocked down Vick’s door: Ben Roethlisberger was lost for four to six weeks with a knee injury .
Suddenly, Vick, who had not started an N.F.L. game since last November, was being asked to save a season.

Week 4 Previews and Picks OCT. 1, 2015 Fantasy Football Week 4: Rankings and Matchup Analysis OCT. 1, 2015 graphic Fantasy Football Rankings 2015 SEPT. 10, 2015 At 35, does the Comeback Kid have one more comeback in him? Raucous Steelers fans were asking the same thing Thursday as Vick made the first of what could be more than a month of starts, against the Baltimore Ravens .
Photo Vick was 19 of 26 for 124 yards with a touchdown and no interceptions against the Ravens on Thursday. Credit Gene J. Puskar/Associated Press Unfortunately for Vick, the Ravens spoiled his debut . But only because the Steelers — and Vick — gave them chance after chance.
A fumbled snap. A missed field goal attempt. And another. Twice in overtime, Vick had chances to put the Steelers in position for a winning field goal attempt. The first ended when he was stopped on a fourth-and-2 run. The second was lost when he overthrew Antonio Brown on fourth-and-1. Vick said that that pass in particular “is going to haunt me for a long time.”
